Hey... I'm still learning :-( Please rephrase your query and try again.

To locate your destination, you can access the NTU interactive map through this link: https://maps.ntu.edu.sg/ 

Remember to enable your location services for real-time directions!

patterns: Where can I find the academic calendar?
responses:
You may access the academic calendar through this link to view your academic schedule and breaks:
https://www.ntu.edu.sg/admissions/matriculation/academic-calendars

patterns: How many AUs do I need?
responses:
You may access this link to view the academic structure for all NTU courses:
https://www.ntu.edu.sg/admissions/matriculation/academic-structure
Every academic year is divided into two semesters. Each semester includes 13 teaching weeks in total and 3 weeks for revision and examinations.

patterns: How are we graded in ntu?
responses:
NTU uses the Grade Point Average System (GPA) for grading.
Grades and grade points are assigned as follows:
 A plus         5.00
 A                  5.00
 A minus      4.50
 B plus          4.00
 B                  3.50
 B minus      3.00
 C plus         2.50
 C                  2.00
 D plus         1.50
 D                 1.00
 F                  0.00

Computation of overall GPA is as follows:
(Sum of [Grade Point x AU] for Course 1...X) / (Total AU attempted in all the semesters so far)

If you are a new student enrolling into NTU, you can use this link to obtain important information and deadlines regarding the matriculation process:
https://www.ntu.edu.sg/admissions/matriculation#Content_C006_Col01

You may use this link to view the degree programmes provided in NTU and read more details about each course:
https://www.ntu.edu.sg/education/degree-programmes#Content_C109_Col01

Here are the links to the various NTU portals:

NTU website: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/
NTUlearn (learning hub): https://ntulearn.ntu.edu.sg/
iNTU (useful links): https://www3.ntu.edu.sg/cits2/iNTU.html

Here's a complete list of contact numbers and emails you can use to get in touch with the various NTU departments if you need help: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/about-us/contact-us

Nanyang Technological University
50 Nanyang Avenue, Singapore 639798

Getting to NTU by car:
The university is located right by the PIE. There are two entrances when travelling via the PIE, take either the Jalan Bahar entrance (Exit 36) or the Pioneer North entrance (Exit 38) to enter the campus.

Getting to NTU by bus:
Service 179 and 199 from Boon Lay Bus Interchange (next to Boon Lay MRT Station) to the University. The services ply from 0600-2400 hrs on weekdays and Saturdays, and from 0630-0020hrs on Sundays and Public Holidays.

Getting to NTU by train:
The nearest train stations to NTU are Boon Lay (EW27) and Pioneer (EW28) on the East-West Line. From Boon Lay station, make your way to the adjacent bus interchange. Services 179 and 199 will take you in to NTU. From Pioneer station, hop on the Campus Rider which stops in front of Blk 649A, Jurong West Street 61, Singapore 641649.

patterns: what shuttle bus do I take?
responses:
There are three shuttle bus routes serving the campus. Campus Loop - Blue (CL-B) and Campus Loop - Red (CL-R) circle the campus with Campus Rider (CR) venturing off-campus to and from Pioneer MRT station. On weekends and holidays, Campus Rider becomes Campus Weekend Rider with an extended route.

For more details and timings of the campus shuttle, click here: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/life-at-ntu/visiting-ntu/internal-campus-shuttle

patterns: where can I park in ntu?
What are the carpark charges in ntu?
responses: There are 5 different carpark zones in campus for all students, staff, and visitors. To view the carpark zones and parking charges in NTU, click here: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/life-at-ntu/visiting-ntu/carpark-zones-charges

patterns: How to check my exam schedule?
Where to check exam seating arrangement?
responses:
Final examinations will be conducted within the next 3 weeks after the 13-weeks school semester ends. Your exam schedule will be listed below your timetable in NTU STARS once your modules are added. You may check your schedule and plan your revisions wisely. To view your exam schedule in STARS, click [here](https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/ldap_login.login?w_url=https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/aus_stars_planner.main).

Exact details such as exam location and seating arrangement will be available nearer to the exam period. You will receive an email when that is out so do check your NTU email before finals!

patterns: How do I check my timetable?
responses: You can check your confirmed timetable for the semester in [NTU STARS](https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/ldap_login.login?w_url=https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/aus_stars_planner.main) after your add/drop period.

Add drop period happens during the first two weeks of the academic semester. During which, students will be able to add modules that they have failed to get during the course registration period. Students can also drop modules which they have already added into their timetable. If you choose to drop a module, you may not be able to add the module back. Success of adding modules during add drop period is entirely up to availability.

Look out for the email at the start of each semester telling you when is the add drop period. You can log in to your [STARS](https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/ldap_login.login?w_url=https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/aus_stars_planner.main) to add or drop modules anytime within the add drop period.

patterns: When will exam results be out?
Where to find my degree audit?
responses: Typically, exam results will be out within a month after your exams end. You will receive an email notifying you when your results are out. You can check your [degree audit](https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/DARS_RESULT_RO.main_display) to view your grades for each semester, as well as your overall CGPA.

Unrestricted electives (UEs) are modules outside of your standard curriculum that you can choose based on interest. Not all modules in NTU are available as a UE. To check, you can click on the module name in your [STARS](https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/ldap_login.login?w_url=https://wish.wis.ntu.edu.sg/pls/webexe/aus_stars_planner.main) before adding it into your timetable.
